title: Swiss Valley Reservoir Walking Route

images.title: Humphrey Bolton / Cwm Lliedi  Reservoir
images.caption: Cwm Lliedi Reservoir. This is near to the upstream end of the reservoir.

images.title: Nigel Davies / Lower Lliedi reservoir, Swiss Valley, Llanelli
images.caption: Lower Lliedi reservoir, Swiss Valley, Llanelli. The view from the path on the west bank of the reservoir, looking east and south.

description: This walk visits the lovely Swiss Valley Reservoirs in Llanelli.  Also known as the Upper Lliedi reservoir and Lower Lliedi reservoir, the area is a fine place for a waterside stroll. The two reservoirs are located just north of the town with a free car park at the northern end of the lower reservoir. From here you can pick up a circular walking trail running around the lake for about 1.7 miles. The trail is tarmacked on one side so suitable for most abilities. On the other side it is a bit rougher so good shoes are required. Just to the west of the site you can pick up the Swiss Valley Cycle Route which runs along a disused railway line. The long distance St Illtyd's Walk also runs past the reservoir. You could pick up this waymarked footpath and follow it south towards Llanelli.
